Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant met the residency requirements under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant was absent from Canada for over 692 days within the four-year period preceding the application; maintained stronger connections to the Middle East than to Canada
Court_Ruling: Citizenship Judge's decision upheld on reasonableness standard
Defendant_Behavior: Frequent and prolonged absences from Canada; inconsistencies in reporting absences
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to meet physical presence requirement for citizenship
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence in Canada, duration of absences, strength of residential ties
Procedural_Issue: Appeal of a Citizenship Judgeâ€™s decision
Credibility_Assessment: Undermined due to discrepancies in reported absences
Evidence_Used: Records of entry and exit, applicant's testimony, documentation of time spent abroad
Application_Basis: Requirement to accumulate at least three years of residence in Canada within four years prior to application
Evidence_Assessed: Duration and pattern of absences, nature and strength of ties to Canada vs. foreign countries
Relief_Sought: Allowance of appeal and approval of citizenship application
Governing_Rule: Applicant must have been physically present in Canada for at least 1095 days within the four years before applying
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Inconsistencies in applicant's account of absences
Outcome: Appeal dismissed; applicant may reapply in the future
Harm_Assessment: No harm established; public interest in enforcing residency requirements upheld
Cause_Description: Applicant's frequent absences from Canada and insufficient residential ties to the country
Evidence_Handling: Discrepancies in self-reported absences weighed against documentary evidence
Evidence_Issues: Inconsistencies in applicant's reporting of time outside Canada
Misrepresentation_Element: Present due to discrepancies in reported absences
Evidence_Assessment: Negative credibility finding based on inconsistent statements
Decision_Rationale: The judge reasonably concluded that the applicant did not meet the physical presence requirement and lacked sufficient ties to Canada
Evidentiary_Issues: Discrepancies between applicant's testimony and travel records
